non_human_language_coverage.description: Identifies and categorizes any non-human languages represented in the dataset.

Code / Programming Language.description: The dataset includes programming or structured code-related content (e.g., Python, HTML, SQL, bytecode).

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of non-human language is present. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: Location in the paper describing this content (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: Justification from the paper indicating that code or programming language is present along with their descriptions.

Mathematical and Logical Notation.description: The dataset contains mathematical or formal logical expressions or symbolic representations.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of non-human language is present. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: Location in the paper describing this content (e.g., 'Section 2.4').

reasoning.description: Justification from the paper indicating the presence of math or logic notation along with their descriptions.

Biological and Non-Human Communication S.description: The dataset includes biological sequences or non-human communication (e.g., DNA, animal signals, chemical signaling).

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of non-human language is present. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: Location in the paper describing this content (e.g., 'Section 5.1').

reasoning.description: Justification from the paper explaining why biological or non-human communication data is included along with their descriptions.

Constructed Language.description: The dataset includes fictional or artificially created languages such as Klingon or Esperanto.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this type of non-human language is present. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: Location in the paper describing this content (e.g., 'Section 6.2').

reasoning.description: Justification from the paper indicating constructed languages are present along with their descriptions.

Unknown.description: The presence or type of non-human language in the dataset is not specified.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the non-human language(s) are not clearly documented. Cannot be true if any other label is true.

reasoning.description: Justification for why the non-human language(s) used in the dataset are considered unknown.

N/A.description: The dataset does not contain any non-human language content.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if no non-human language is present. Cannot be true if any other label is true.

reasoning.description: Justification from the paper showing that no non-human language is used.
